title: Six English towns: a pattern of building. - Volume 1.
brief_description: The eminent architectural historian Alec Clifton Taylor presents three of his personal favourites - a choice based on each town’s character and visual impact rather than dry historical fact. With his unrivalled knowledge of building materials and a discerning eye, the viewer learns to appreciate Chichester’s marvellous use of flint, the “bastard” limestone of Richmond and the fan vaulting of Tewkesbury Abbey. A delightful, informative program for both those with a passion for architecture and those who know little.
